# Class ToolCallResult

Class for managing a single tool call result.

This class represents the result of executing a tool call, containing the tool call ID and the result string. It extends BaseData to provide consistent lifecycle management and external reference handling.

#### Example


```
const toolCallResult = new ToolCallResult('call_123', '&#123;"temperature": 72&#125;');const result = toolCallResult.getToolCallResult();console.log(result.toolCallId); // 'call_123'console.log(result.result); // '&#123;"temperature": 72&#125;'toolCallResult.destroy(); // Clean up when done

```


##### Index

### Methods

destroy getToolCallResult isValid onDestroy

## Methods

  * destroy(): void

Cleans up resources associated with this data.

#### Returns void

Inherited from BaseData.destroy




### getToolCallResult

  * getToolCallResult(): [ToolCallResultInterface](/interfaces/common_data_types_external_tool_call_data.ToolCallResultInterface)

Gets the tool call result as a ToolCallResultInterface.

#### Returns [ToolCallResultInterface](/interfaces/common_data_types_external_tool_call_data.ToolCallResultInterface)

Object containing the tool call ID and result string




### isValid

  * isValid(): any

Checks if the ToolCallResult instance is valid.

#### Returns any

True if the instance is valid, false otherwise




### onDestroy

  * onDestroy(): void

Destroys the ToolCallResult instance and frees associated resources. This method should be called when the object is no longer needed to prevent memory leaks.

#### Returns void
